subdisciplines.name: Computational Logic
subdisciplines.description: The study of how computers can be used to model and reason about logical systems.

subdisciplines.name: Mathematical Logic
subdisciplines.description: The study of mathematical structures and their applications to logic

subdisciplines.name: Modal Logic
subdisciplines.description: The study of reasoning about necessity and possibility.

subdisciplines.name: Philosophical Logic
subdisciplines.description: The study of logic in relation to philosophy, especially in evaluating arguments and reasoning.

subdisciplines.name: Non-Classical Logic
subdisciplines.description: The study of logical systems that operate outside the scope of traditional boolean logic.

subdisciplines.name: Meta-Logic
subdisciplines.description: The study of the foundations, principles, and methods of logic itself.
